alert.note: Alert for Okfuskee; Okmulgee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 1:12AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Okmulgee and southeastern Okfuskee Counties through 145 AM CDT... At 112 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 6 miles south of Cromwell, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Henryetta... Weleetka... Bearden... Clearview... Pharoah... Bryant... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 212 and 216, and between mile markers 231 and 237. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
